column4: Hi all - nautilus is not auto-mounting USB pen drives... I plug in and the device shows in /deb/sdb and lsusb list the device, but it doesn't show in my computer or on the desktop - any ideas ?
I had to make an adjustment for Virtual Box, but restored it to original...
Dr_willis I would like the drive to be auto mounted ... compuer sees the drive and it goes in /deb/sd* but doesn't show n nautilus... (I have display volumes set)
oh and thats probably your problem right there

Yeah, type... I have not added anything to fstab.. I shouldn't have to though, I wouldn't think... DOesn't nautilus/ubuntu support automounting... I also have another computer - same issue... when drive *is* in fstab but doesn't show on Nautilus...
it's strange? as my usb drives automount
Yep, habe the issue on two computers... I have a usb HD in fstab and it doens't show in nautilus, those I can access at /media/DriveName
to automount internal/external drives you can edit /etc/fstab but USB drives hould by default do it
It's very frustrating... thinking of resort to reinstalling Ubuntu - the icky Windows way to fix a problem...
by show in nautilus do you mean on the desktop?
Desktop and Computer (yes I have show volumes checked)
in computer it should be in /media/DriveName. is it not there anywhere?
